docs.snippet: Kansas City, the American League Central leader, needed little more than a third-inning run and strong pitching to secure a victory at Yankee Stadium....
docs.lead_paragraph: Kansas City, the American League Central leader, needed little more than a third-inning run and strong pitching to secure a victory at Yankee Stadium.
docs.abstract: Kansas City Royals beat New York Yankees, 1-0.

headline.main: In Win, Royals Show the Confidence of a Division Leader
headline.print_headline: In Win, Royals Show the Confidence of a Division Leader

docs.snippet: In a surprise move, Washington said he was quitting to deal with a personal matter, and the Rangers’ general manager said the move was not drug related....
docs.lead_paragraph: In a surprise move, Washington said he was quitting to deal with a personal matter, and the Rangers’ general manager said the move was not drug related.
docs.abstract: MLB Roundup; Texas Rangers manager Ron Washington unexpectedly resigns, citing need to devote his full attention to a personal matter; other baseball news and scores noted.

headline.main: Ron Washington Resigns as Manager of Rangers

docs.snippet: Curtis Granderson and Travis d’Arnaud each hit a three-run homer on Friday night to power the Mets to their third straight win, a 14-5 victory over the Cincinnati Reds....
docs.lead_paragraph: Curtis Granderson and Travis d’Arnaud each hit a three-run homer on Friday night to power the Mets to their third straight win, a 14-5 victory over the Cincinnati Reds.
docs.abstract: New York Mets beat Cincinnati Reds, 14-5, behind five home runs.

docs.snippet: Described by a San Diego newspaper as “arguably the greatest athlete ever to come out of San Diego County,” Powell excelled at pro football, baseball and boxing....
docs.lead_paragraph: Described by a San Diego newspaper as “arguably the greatest athlete ever to come out of San Diego County,” Powell excelled at pro football, baseball and boxing.
docs.abstract: Charlie Powell, remarkable athlete who excelled in professional football, baseball and boxing, dies at age 82.

headline.main: Charlie Powell, a Standout Regardless of the Sport, Dies at 82
headline.print_headline: Charlie Powell, 82, a Standout Regardless of the Sport

docs.snippet: The Yankees and the Cardinals met for Game 7 of the World Series as a series of momentous events shook the world....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Yankees and the Cardinals met for Game 7 of the World Series as a series of momentous events shook the world.
docs.abstract: The Upshot; Michael Beschloss History Source column recalls Game 7 of the 1964 World Series between the New York Yankees and St Louis Cardinals; notes that game unfolded against backdrop of stunning events, including scandal in Pres Lyndon B Johnson's White House, ouster of Soviet leader Nikita Khrushchev amid coup in Russia and the first successful test of a nuclear weapon by 'Red' China.

headline.main: The Earth Stood Still, but the Game Played On
headline.print_headline: The Day the Earth Stood Still, but the Game Played On

headline.main: Athletics Rally for 4-3 Win Over Astros
headline.print_headline: Athletics Rally for 4-3 Win Over Astros

docs.snippet: Corey Kluber pitched a five-hitter to win for the first time in a month, rookie Jose Ramirez hit a go-ahead triple in a two-run seventh inning and the Cleveland Indians beat the Chicago White Sox 3-1 Saturday night....
docs.lead_paragraph: Corey Kluber pitched a five-hitter to win for the first time in a month, rookie Jose Ramirez hit a go-ahead triple in a two-run seventh inning and the Cleveland Indians beat the Chicago White Sox 3-1 Saturday night.

headline.main: Kluber's 5-Hitter Leads Indians Over White Sox 3-1
headline.print_headline: Kluber's 5-Hitter Leads Indians Over White Sox 3-1

docs.snippet: Michael Chang knows what it takes to win a Grand Slam title as a player. Lately, as a coach, he's been trying to transmit some of that knowledge to Kei Nishikori while helping guide him to the U.S. Open final....
docs.lead_paragraph: Michael Chang knows what it takes to win a Grand Slam title as a player. Lately, as a coach, he's been trying to transmit some of that knowledge to Kei Nishikori while helping guide him to the U.S. Open final.

headline.main: '89 French Champ Chang Helps Nishikori to US Final
